meanings.definition: To attract or become attracted to a magnet.
meanings.sent1: The metal paperclip was magnetized and stuck to the fridge.
meanings.sent2: The compass needle magnetized towards the north pole.
meanings.sent3: The toy car seemed to magnetize all the other toys to follow it around.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had the power to magnetize everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The magician's wand seemed to magnetize objects from a distance.

meanings.sent1: She used the special tool to magnetize the screwdriver.
meanings.sent2: The scientist magnetized the metal bar by rubbing it with a magnet.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's gloves were so powerful they could magnetize any object they touched.
meanings.sent4: The magnetic field seemed to magnetize all the nearby metal objects.
meanings.sent5: The wizard's spell was able to magnetize even non-metallic items.

meanings.definition: To exert a strong attractive power or charm.
meanings.sent1: The charismatic leader could magnetize crowds with his speeches.
meanings.sent2: The beautiful artwork magnetized visitors to the gallery.
meanings.sent3: The delicious smell of freshly baked cookies seemed to magnetize everyone in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: Her presence in the room seemed to magnetize all attention towards her.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious aura of the old house seemed to magnetize curious explorers.
